TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ListViewGroupCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable, class System.Collections.IList
type ListViewGroupCollection = class interface IList interface ICollection interface IEnumerable

summary.span: 表示 控件中的组的集合。

span.span: Represents the collection of groups within a control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用 属性可获取 与控件关联的 。Use the property to get the associated with a control. 当属性设置为之外的值时，此集合包含的 对象表示控件中显示的组 。This collection contains the objects that represent the groups shown in the control when the property is set to a value other than . 未分配给组的任何项都将显示在默认组中，其标题标签为 "DefaultGroup {0} "。Any items that are not assigned to a group will appear in the default group, which has the header label "DefaultGroup{0}". 默认组不包含在 集合中，因此无法更改。The default group is not contained in the collection, and cannot be altered. 它主要用于调试，以确保所有项都已正确添加到组中。It is primarily useful in debugging to ensure that all items have been properly added to groups. 如果集合中没有组，则 禁用分组功能。If there are no groups in the collection, the grouping feature is disabled. 使用 方法向集合中添加单个组。Use the method to add a single group to the collection. 使用 方法可在集合中的特定索引处添加组。Use the method to add a group at a particular index within the collection. 若要删除组，请使用 方法。To remove a group, use the method. 使用 方法可移除特定索引处的组。Use the method to remove the group at a particular index. 不能多次将添加 到集合中。You cannot add a to the collection more than once. 若要在集合中重新定位组，必须先将其从集合中删除，然后再插入到所需的位置。To reposition a group within the collection, it must first be removed from the collection, and then inserted at the desired location. 使用 方法可确定集合中是否已存在特定组。Use the method to determine whether a particular group is already in the collection. 若要检索集合中组的索引，请使用 方法。To retrieve the index of a group within the collection, use the method. 您可以使用索引器获取或设置特定索引处的组 。You can get or set the group at a particular index with the indexer. 使用 方法将多个组添加到集合中。Use the method to add multiple groups to the collection. 可以将多个组添加为组的数组，或添加为 通过 另一个控件的属性检索的组 。You can add multiple groups either as an array of groups or as a that you retrieve through the property of another control. 使用 方法可从集合中删除所有组。Use the method to remove all the groups from the collection. > [!NOTE] > 、 和 方法从集合中移除组，但不会从控件中移除任何项 。The , , and methods remove groups from the collection, but do not remove any items from the control. 如果集合中没有组，则 会禁用分组功能，并正常显示控件中的所有项。If there are no groups in the collection, the grouping feature is disabled and all items in the control are displayed normally. 当你希望提供多种方式来对控件中的项进行分组时，和方法非常有用 。The and methods are useful when you want to provide multiple ways to group the items in a control. 为此，请创建多个组数组。To do this, create multiple group arrays. 若要更改分组，请首先使用 方法从集合中移除所有组，然后使用 方法添加要显示的下一组组。To change the grouping, first use the method to remove all the groups from the collection, then use the method to add the next array of groups to display. 使用 方法可从指定索引处开始，将集合中的组复制到兼容的数组。Use the method to copy the groups in a collection to a compatible array starting at a specified index. 例如，当你想要使用方法对集合中的组进行排序时，这会很有用 。This is useful, for example, when you want to sort the groups in the collection using the method. 为此，请将组复制到一个兼容的数组中，然后对该数组进行排序。To do this, copy the groups into a compatible array, then sort the array. 接下来，使用 方法从集合中移除所有组，然后使用 方法将已排序的数组添加回集合。Next, use the method to remove all the groups from the collection, then use the method to add the sorted array back to the collection. 使用 属性来确定集合中有多少个组。Use the property to determine how many groups are in the collection. 若要循环访问集合，请使用 从方法返回的 。To iterate through the collection, use the returned from the method. > [!NOTE] > 只有在应用程序调用方法时，才可以在 Windows XP 和 Windows Server 2003 家族上使用分组功能 。The grouping feature is available only on Windows XP and the Windows Server 2003 family when your application calls the method. 在早期的操作系统上，将忽略任何与组相关的代码，且不会显示这些组。On earlier operating systems, any code relating to groups will be ignored and the groups will not appear. 因此，依赖于分组功能的任何代码可能无法正常工作。As a result, any code that depends on the grouping feature might not work correctly. 您可能想要包括一个确定分组功能是否可用的测试，并在其不可用时提供其他功能。You might want to include a test that determines whether the grouping feature is available, and provide alternate functionality when it is unavailable. 例如，当在不支持按组进行排序的操作系统上运行时，可能需要提供备用排序。For example, you might want to provide alternate sorting when running on operating systems that do not support sorting by group. > > 插入标记功能由提供操作系统主题功能的相同库提供。The insertion mark feature is provided by the same library that provides the operating system themes feature. 若要检查此库的可用性，请调用 方法重载，并传入 值。To check for the availability of this library, call the method overload and pass in the value. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用 分组功能按详细信息视图中的子项值组织项。The following example demonstrates how to use the grouping feature to organize items by subitem value in the details view. 这种形式的分组类似于 Windows 资源管理器中使用的分组。This form of grouping is similar to the grouping used in Windows Explorer. 在此示例中，将动态创建组。In the example, the groups are created dynamically. 对于每个子项列，将为每个唯一子项值创建一个组。For each subitem column, one group is created for each unique subitem value. 对于 "父项" 列，将为每个唯一的初始字母创建一个组。For the parent item column, one group is created for each unique initial letter. 单击列标题可将项排序到为该列创建的组中。Clicking the header of a column sorts the items into the groups created for that column. 再次单击同一个列标题会反转组的顺序。Clicking the same column header again reverses the order of the groups. [!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.ListView.Groups#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.ListView.Groups/CPP/listviewgroupsexample.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.ListView.Groups#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.ListView.Groups/CS/listviewgroupsexample.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.ListView.Groups#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.ListView.Groups/VB/listviewgroupsexample.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用此方法可将现有添加 到集合中。Use this method to add an existing to the collection. 不能多次将添加 到集合中。You cannot add a to the collection more than once. 如果 使用 集合中已有的调用方法，则添加操作将失败并返回-1。When you call the method using a that is already in the collection, the addition fails and -1 is returned. 若要向集合中添加多个组，请使用 方法。To add multiple groups to the collection, use the method.

summary.span: 向集合中添加组的数组。

span.span: Adds an array of groups to the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用此版本的 方法将组数组添加到组集合。Use this version of the method to add an array of groups to the group collection. 当你创建多个 对象并希望通过单个方法调用将它们添加到集合时，此方法非常有用。This method is useful when you create multiple objects and want to add them to the collection with a single method call. 若要向集合中添加单个组，请使用 方法。To add individual groups to the collection, use the method. 当你希望提供多种方式来对控件中的项进行分组时，此方法也非常有用 。This method is also useful when you want to provide multiple ways to group the items in a control. 为此，请创建多个组数组。To do this, create multiple group arrays. 若要更改分组，请首先使用 方法从集合中移除所有组，然后使用 方法添加不同的组数组。To change the grouping, first use the method to remove all the groups from the collection, then use the method to add a different array of groups. 与 方法不同， 方法没有返回值可用于确定要添加的组是否已存在于集合中。Unlike the method, the method does not have a return value that can be used to determine whether a group being added is already in the collection. 如果需要此信息，请使用方法， 然后再使用 方法。If you need this information, use the method before using the method. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何 在应用程序中使用方法，该方法 按详细信息视图中的子项值组织项。The following example demonstrates how the method can be used in an application that organizes items by subitem value in the details view. 这种形式的分组类似于 Windows 资源管理器中使用的分组。This form of grouping is similar to the grouping used in Windows Explorer. 在此示例中，将动态创建组。In the example, the groups are created dynamically. 对于每个子项列，将为每个唯一子项值创建一个组。For each subitem column, one group is created for each unique subitem value. 对于 "父项" 列，将为每个唯一的初始字母创建一个组。For the parent item column, one group is created for each unique initial letter. 为每个列创建的组与子项文本或首字母一起存储在哈希表中。The groups created for each column are stored in a hash table along with the subitem text or initial letter. 单击列标题时， 将清除。When a column header is clicked, the is cleared. 然后，将检索对应于单击的列的哈希表，并将每个项分配给相应的组。The hash table corresponding to the clicked column is then retrieved and each item is assigned to the appropriate group. 最后，将哈希表中的组的已排序数组添加到 。Finally, a sorted array of the groups in the hash table is added to the . 有关完整示例，请参阅 概述参考主题。For the complete example, see the overview reference topic. [!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.ListView.Groups#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.ListView.Groups/CPP/listviewgroupsexample.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.ListView.Groups#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.ListView.Groups/CS/listviewgroupsexample.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.ListView.Groups#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.ListView.Groups/VB/listviewgroupsexample.vb#2)]

summary.span: 从集合中移除所有组。

span.span: Removes all groups from the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用此方法可从集合中删除所有组。Use this method to remove all the groups from the collection. 请注意，从集合中删除组 并不会删除控件中的项 。Note that removing groups from the collection does not remove items from the control. 此方法对于禁用分组功能很有用。This method is useful to disable the grouping feature. 如果控件中没有组 ，则项会正常显示。When there are no groups in a control, the items appear normally. 若要从集合中移除单个组，请使用 或 方法。To remove individual groups from the collection, use the or method. 当你希望提供多种方法对项进行分组时，此方法也非常有用。This method is also useful when you want to provide multiple ways to group the items. 若要更改分组，请首先使用 方法从集合中移除所有组，然后使用 方法添加不同的组数组。To change the grouping, first use the method to remove all the groups from the collection, then use the method to add a different array of groups. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何 在应用程序中使用方法，该方法 按详细信息视图中的子项值组织项。The following example demonstrates how the method can be used in an application that organizes items by subitem value in the details view. 这种形式的分组类似于 Windows 资源管理器中使用的分组。This form of grouping is similar to the grouping used in Windows Explorer. 在此示例中，将动态创建组。In the example, the groups are created dynamically. 对于每个子项列，将为每个唯一子项值创建一个组。For each subitem column, one group is created for each unique subitem value. 对于 "父项" 列，将为每个唯一的初始字母创建一个组。For the parent item column, one group is created for each unique initial letter. 为每个列创建的组与子项文本或首字母一起存储在哈希表中。The groups created for each column are stored in a hash table along with the subitem text or initial letter. 单击列标题时， 将清除。When a column header is clicked, the is cleared. 然后，将检索对应于单击的列的哈希表，并将每个项分配给相应的组。The hash table corresponding to the clicked column is then retrieved and each item is assigned to the appropriate group. 最后，将哈希表中的组的已排序数组添加到 。Finally, a sorted array of the groups in the hash table is added to the . 有关完整示例，请参阅 概述参考主题。For the complete example, see the overview reference topic. [!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.ListView.Groups#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.ListView.Groups/CPP/listviewgroupsexample.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.ListView.Groups#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.ListView.Groups/CS/listviewgroupsexample.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.ListView.Groups#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.ListView.Groups/VB/listviewgroupsexample.vb#2)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 不能多次将添加 到集合中。You cannot add a to the collection more than once. 不过，尝试添加其他副本不会引发异常。However, attempting to add another copy will not throw an exception. 相反，添加将失败。Instead, the addition will simply fail. 在这种情况下，该方法将返回值-1。The method will return a value of -1 in this case. 但和 方法没有返回值。The and methods, however, do not have return values. 当使用其中一种方法添加组时，请使用 方法来确定 集合中是否已存在特定的。When adding groups using one of these methods, use the method to determine whether a particular is already in the collection.

span.span: Copies the groups in the collection to a compatible one-dimensional , starting at the specified index of the target array.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用 方法可从指定索引处开始，将集合中的组（ (包含它们包含) 的项引用）复制到兼容的数组中。Use the method to copy the groups in a collection (including the item references they contain) to a compatible array, starting at a specified index. 例如，当你想要使用方法对集合中的组进行排序时，这会很有用 。This is useful, for example, when you want to sort the groups in the collection using the method. 为此，请将组复制到一个兼容的数组中，然后对该数组进行排序。To do this, copy the groups into a compatible array, then sort the array. 接下来，使用 方法从集合中移除所有组，然后使用 方法将已排序的数组添加回集合。Next, use the method to remove all the groups from the collection, then use the method to add the sorted array back to the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用此方法可将现有的插入到 集合中的特定索引处。Use this method to insert an existing at a particular index within the collection. 不能多次将添加 到集合中。You cannot add a to the collection more than once. 当 使用集合中已有的组调用方法时，插入操作将失败。When you call the method using a group that is already in the collection, the insertion simply fails. 使用 插入前的方法来确定特定组是否已存在于集合中。Use the method before the insertion to determine whether a particular group is already in the collection. 若要在集合中重新定位组，必须先将其删除，然后将其插入到所需的索引处。To reposition a group within the collection, you must first remove it, and then insert it at the desired index.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果具有对组的引用，请使用此方法从集合中删除组。Use this method to remove a group from the collection when you have a reference to the group. 请注意，从集合中删除组 并不会删除控件中的项 。Note that removing a group from the collection does not remove items from the control. 若要删除特定索引中的组，请改用 方法。To remove a group at a particular index, use the method instead. 若要从集合中移除所有组，请使用 方法。To remove all the groups from the collection, use the method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 当集合中有组的索引时，使用此方法从集合中删除组。Use this method to remove a group from the collection when you have the index of the group within the collection. 请注意，从集合中删除组 并不会删除控件中的项 。Note that removing groups from the collection does not remove items from the control. 若要使用对该对象的引用删除组，请改用 方法。To remove a group using a reference to the object, use the method instead. 若要从集合中移除所有组，请使用 方法。To remove all the groups from the collection, use the method. 从集合中移除项时，集合中的后续项的索引会发生更改。When you remove an item from the collection, the indexes change for subsequent items in the collection. 删除的项的所有信息都将被删除。All information about the removed item is deleted.
